turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Let's go.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: No, wait here.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Dewey?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: There's nothing. I'm coming down.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Three hundred people watched? Nobody did anything?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: They thought it was a publicity stunt.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Oh my God. How could it happen?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: They don't know. It was carefully planned. Earlier in the day the victims received anonymous passes to the movie.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: It's a copycat killer I knew this would happen. That fucking movie.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: As of now, they don't see any relation. But they're checking it out. The state, Special Task Force, FBI--they're all here. They'll find the guy.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Yeah, right.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Look, Sid, why don't you take off? Disappear for a few days. I'll come with you.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: No. I will not crawl under a rock. This is a fucked-up world and people kill people all the time. I'll just get used to it.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: You go, it's all stairs, I can take it from here.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Don't worry...

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Dewey, I'm completely equipped with mace, alarm whistle, keyring, knife, a degree in defensive combat...

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Just in case...

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: No. This is nothing, Dewey. I'll be okay. Go back to work and let me get back to my quasi pseudo-happy existence.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: The police are waiting outside. They're going to take you somewhere safe.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Dewey, there's no such place.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Humor me, Sid.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Hey, I got stuff to do. But I'll find you later, okay.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Whatever.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Who is this?

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: I'll give you one guess.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Who are you?

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: That's not the way we play the game.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: I don't play games.

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: What if your life depended on it?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: You're pretty when you're angry.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Where are you?

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: I'm everywhere.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Oh--a God complex

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: Stay away from the cop.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: What do you want from me?

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: It's what you want from me.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: You are writing another book, aren't you? That's why you're here. The story's not over.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: You're getting obvious.

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: No, Gale, I'm just getting started. Seeya soon.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: No, wait...

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: Watch your back.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Sidney. Hello. How are you?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I'm okay. PEOPLE magazine won't stop calling but other than that...

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Yeah, well...you are the definition of mixed emotions. I really should hate you... I see your movie's getting good reviews.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: It seems to be causing a stir. What's with the toilet paper?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: It's hell week. I'm pledging the Deltas.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: It's good to see you involved.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: My morn was a Delta.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Sid, I'll come with you.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: But who would operate your camera?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Oh my God.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Someones trying to kill me. I need the police.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Are you in danger now?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Yes, goddammit!

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Where is your attacker?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: I dont know.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Stay under the safety light. Help is on its way.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: The safety what? Fuck that!

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Lucas and his Romper Room stage.

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: I got. I got it. FRIDAY THE 13TH, PART 20.

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: I have rehearsal.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I have to watch rehearsal.

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: Shut up. Mickey, you and I can take her late evening.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Sig Ep's gotta band, tonight.

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: Too bad.

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: He tried to kill her first.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Is Sid in therapy?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I got a surprise for you.

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: "If I should stay. I would only be in your way. So I'll go. And yet, I know, I'll think of you each step of the way...

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: Don't do this.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: "And IIIIIIIIIYEIIIII will always love you OOOOOOWUOOOOOOOO will always love you."

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: You're going to get it. You know what happens.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: But I love you. And I want the whole world to know it.

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: Knock yourself out.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Hello?  Hello?

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: Time to change numbers again?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Nah...I think it'll die off. It's opening weekend. Let's see how it goes.

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: Okay, you're sure about skipping Calculas?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Please, I have the perfect excuse.

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: What about rehearsal?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Gotta.

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: I'll cover you through rehearsal. Derek when do you get outta docu- drama?

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: That was good.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Yeah, right.

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: Who is that guy?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: It's okay. Look, Hallie, I'll meet you outside.

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: No, girletta, I don't leave your side.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I've got my entourage. Take a break. Please.

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: We're missing the Sig Ep party.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: No, Hallie, not tonight. Parties and mass murderers don't go together. Trust me.

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: No, no, I hadn't planned on going, it's just Mickey will be pissed.

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: It's okay to break, girl. You shatter if you have to.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I'd really just like to be alone.

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: Can I come with her?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: No, Hallie, I'm not gonna take you down too. I'll be alright.

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: I'm the only one who can cut him down.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: It's not a good idea, Hallie.

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: Oh, Sid, youre sounding desparate. I guess fearing death makes one anxious.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: You fucking freaked out movie nut psychos..

turns.speaker: ON SCREEN
turns.text: A patio chair comes flying through a glass door. The young girl in the movie tears off running, SCREAMING, flying through the room.

turns.speaker: IN THE THEATER
turns.text: The crowd is really with the movie. Some even talk to the screen. "You dumb bitch. Get out of the house." etc.

turns.speaker: ON SCREEN
turns.text: The young girl runs by a window. She looks in. A GHOST MASKED KILLER stares back. The Figure CRASHES through the window attacking her. She fights him off, getting away, running...

turns.speaker: IN THE THEATER
turns.text: Everyone in the theater is SCREAMING. Maureen tries her best to detach herself from the movie. She eats her popcorn.

turns.speaker: ON SCREEN
turns.text: The Ghost advances on the young girl, grabbing her, pulling her to him, raising high a long, hunting knife. The young girl is helpless...

turns.speaker: IN THE THEATER
turns.text: Maureen looks at Phil, confused...as if seeing for the first time...IT'S NOT PHIL. She pulls away when, the Ghost-masked Figure grabs her with one hand, the other one clutching the hunting knife. Maureen sees it, her mouth billowing forth a LOUD SCREAM That is matched by the entire audience as they SCREAM at the screen.

turns.speaker: ON SCREEN
turns.text: The young girl, clutching her bloody chest...drags herself, crawling across wet grass...the killer behind her...raising his knife again.

turns.speaker: IN THE THEATER
turns.text: Popcorn flies as Maureen falls forward, into the aisle, clutching her bloody stomach. She's speechless, unable to SCREAM. She holds her bloody hand out for all to see, begging for help. She stumbles down the aisle. Someone YELLS "Sit down." Maureen turns to several PEOPLE who begin to react. She turns behind her to see the Ghost Face coming at her again...knife raised.

turns.speaker: ON SCREEN
turns.text: The young girl is slashed again.

turns.speaker: IN THE THEATER
turns.text: The knife slices into Maureen again...then again. The theatre audience is starting to take note as the Ghost keeps slashing at her repeatedly with the knife. A horrifying, sickening sight.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: How many guys they have on you?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I counted four.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I've been waiting for you, baby.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Is that cool? Just to leave her like that?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Randy Meeks.  He was with Sid that night in Woodsboro.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Her old boyfriend?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: No, she killed her boyfriend. Randy was a friend. MICKEY Watch out, Derek.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: And white.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Easy black boy.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: It's documented. Most serial killers are attractive--slightly off white males in their twenties.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Have they questioned you yet, Sid?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: This has nothing to do with me, Joel. There's an estimated 270 serial killers currently active in the US at any given time. I can't control that. Who's hungry?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I gotta hit the library. Anatomy. Some of us have real majors. You gonna be okay, Sid?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: You're not allowed to ask that.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I'll stop by the Deltas tonight.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Thanks, Joel.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Perfect. I'll be outta Micro-bio and we can grab a bite.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Guys, guys, I'm sorry but, no way.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Sid, I'll seeya tonight.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: But...

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: ..this week's TKE kegger...

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Ne ask that you sell individual squares of toilet paper for a mere nickel a piece.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: We've set you each at a five dollar quota.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: It's all about sisterhood. Everybody thinks its about partying and blowjobs but...

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: ..we only promote safe rubbered sex.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: ..it's really about family and tradition...

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: ..harmonica style is okay.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: I just love being a sister.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: Gale?

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: She's not here right now.

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: But she's standing right next to you.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: What do you care? Let 'em have their fun. So, what's up?

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: What's your favorite scary movie?

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: SHOWGIRLS. Absolutely frightening. What's yours? Wait, let me guess. THE HOUSE ON SORORITY ROW? FINAL EXAM. GRADUATION DAY? THE DORM THAT DRIPPED BLOOD? SPLATTER UNIVERSITY? Am I close?

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: Closer than you think.

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: Do you want to die?

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: Gee, let me think. "Do you want to..." Is that the best you can do? Some tired hand me down rehash? Hey, pal, no one's gonna write a book about you. No movie rights. Nothing. I've been through this before and much better I might add.

turns.speaker: MAUREEN
turns.text: I hate scary movies.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: It'll be okay, baby, I'll hold your hand.

turns.speaker: MAUREEN
turns.text: If we hurry, we can still catch the Sandra Bullock movie.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: We got free tickets.

turns.speaker: MAUREEN
turns.text: Take it off.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: But...

turns.speaker: MAUREEN
turns.text: Now.

turns.speaker: MAUREEN
turns.text: Now why does she have to be naked? How does that serve the plot?

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Sssshhh. ON SCREEN The phone RINGS. The young girl pulls the shower curtain aside to reveal a robe hung on a hook. She grabs it, running from the bathroom, into the living room, grabbing the phone.

turns.speaker: MAUREEN
turns.text: Why doesn't she just hang up and call the police? Stupid..

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Shush.

turns.speaker: MAUREEN
turns.text: I'm gonna pee. You want anything?

turns.speaker: MAUREEN
turns.text: You ass.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: I'm sorry, I'm sorry but I had to. It was too easy.

turns.speaker: MAUREEN
turns.text: You are so not funny.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Come on, baby. Lighten up a little, will ya?

turns.speaker: MAUREEN
turns.text: I get scared really easy, okay.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: You gotta go with it. Scary movies are great foreplay.

turns.speaker: MAUREEN
turns.text: I just have a hard time with insipid, sexist violence.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: We can still Sandra Bullock it.

turns.speaker: MAUREEN
turns.text: Sandra started without us. We can stay. He kisses her again, then breaks away.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Sid? Jesus, where's Hallie? I've been here all night.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Listen to me. We've got to get help. The Killer's here.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: He's after me.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I'll be right back.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Where you going?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: What was that?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Don't panic.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: I'm sorry, Sid, please. I never should have gone along with Gale. I know I'm stupid. I wish I had some good reason to give you but I'm just stupid. Please, Sid, don't be mad at me.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Do you work for her now?

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: Well, yeah...she gave me a job. Freelance. It got me outta Woodsboro. I'm sorry about Cotton and yesterday. It was a bad idea. I knew it was a bad idea but it seemed like a quasi harmless bad idea. Ah, shit, Sid, I'm fucked up. Sidney looks at him Long and hard, a smile slowly appearing.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Me, too. Randy. Me too.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: If he's innocent he'll have an alibi.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I guess Gale's going to be pissed she missed her exclusive.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: I'll relay it. You sure you don't wanna go home?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I have this button I press. See? It insulates me. She mimes an air lock valve.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: I gotta coupla of those buttons myself.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Thanks for the movie, Randy.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: Anytime. Sorry it sucked. It just had that been there done that feeling.

turns.speaker: ANGELINA
turns.text: I think Jeff Bridges is getting tired.

turns.speaker: TYSON
turns.text: Nah I think it's doing so damn well because one of it's players got iced. I just hope none of us end up dead.

turns.speaker: ANGELINA
turns.text: Oh that's right. Those poor poor people. God Ben Damon was such a hottie.

turns.speaker: TYSON
turns.text: And that CICI chick wasn't that bad either but I'm really concerned about my safety now.

turns.speaker: ANGELINA
turns.text: There's always someone out there stalking actors. Look at that woman from the Commish.

turns.speaker: TYSON
turns.text: Melinda McGraw?

turns.speaker: ANGELINA
turns.text: No, the other one. The one who played his wife.

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: No, Jennifer Love Hewitt. Of course it's me, silly. And I feel like an ass standing in this theater lobby all by myself. Where are you babe, the movie starts in twenty minutes.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Look, I'm stuck on the freeway. I think there was some big accident. It could be a little while so I don't want you to start freaking if I don't get there at exactly,  Eight thirty.

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: All I'm saying is I'm gonna be royally p.o.'d if you don't catch my acting debut.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Oh I wouldn't miss it for the world. I bet you did such a great job.

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: I did. Hon, although I got a total of six minutes screen time, they're the best six minutes of the movie.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Heh heh I bet they are babe. I bet they are. Look, my battery's dying . . .

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Jesus.  Hello?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Who is this?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Who is this?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Well what number are you trying to reach?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I think you got the wrong number, buddy.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Do I?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Uh-huh. Look bro, my battery is running out. Really wish I could chat, but I can't so, later.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Wait, wait. Don't hang up.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Asshole, Can't talk.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: But your voice sounds so familiar.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: You almost sound like that guy from THERE'S SOMETHING ABOUT CARRIE. Ben. Ben Damon.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Well ya got me. That's me. I'm Ben Damon.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Really? You're such a talented actor.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Now let's see you act your way out of this one.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: I mean, I'm standing right outside the LADIES ROOM door at the PLAZA THEATER. Your girlfriend Christine is in there.  She's all alone. Everyone's in the auditorium waiting for the film to start.  I've got my knife.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Listen you sick fuck, is this your idea of a joke?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: More of a game really.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: What kind of a game?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: You seem to be familiar with the STAB movies. Here's how we play. I ask you a question. You get it right, your girlfriend lives. You answer wrong, she dies.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I swear to God if you lay a finger on her I'll fucking kill you!

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Maybe so, but right now, we play the game. First question, Your girlfriend's counting on you, Name your girlfriend's character in STAB 2?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: It's CICI! Cici's the name of the character she plays in the movie!

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Very good. Now we play ROUND 2.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: What?! But I did everything you said to do!

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: That's right. And you beat ROUND 1. Now we're taking the game to a whole new level.  Meet me beneath the Hollywood sign in ten minutes. I'll have your girlfriend. We'll be waiting.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Good bye Ben.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: You're not playing by the rules Ben. Don't you want her to live?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I swear to God if you lay one hand on her!

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: No! You listen to me, if you're not where I want you in fifteen minutes I'll hollow her out. Do you understand?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Very good. You follow directions well. Now for the final part of the game. Put down the bat and approach the sign, slowly.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Where are you?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Closer than you think.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Alright I'm here. What the fuck do you want from me?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: To see your reaction.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Reaction to what?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Can I help you?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: I'm Gale Weathers, author of the Woodsboro and Windsor College murders, and anchorwoman for TOTAL ENTERTAINMENT. Maybe you've heard of me?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: I don't watch TV and I hate books. Whatta you need?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Does the name Maureen Prescott sound familiar to you?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Nope.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Well can you tell me if the woman in this picture looks familiar to you.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Listen, I'm busy. Nobody has access to those files except studio execs. Can you please go away now?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Well if you won't work for me, will you work for the president?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: I know every face in here, respect for the unknown actor I suppose, myself included. If you're looking for Maureen Prescott --

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: It may be Maureen Reynolds --

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Well you'll find neither. Rina Reynolds, however, You will.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: What are these movies? 'Amazombies', 'Space Psychos' 'Creatures from theSan Andreas Fault'?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Horror flicks. B-Movies from Milton's heyday.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Jesus Christ you scared the shit out of me.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: I'm sorry Miss Weathers. Allow me to introduce myself, MARK KINCAID, L.A.P.D.  Are you familiar with the actor Ben Damon, or the actress CHRISTINE PERKINS?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Well I interviewed Damon once for the show. He was a real obnoxious fuck. Any way, the second one, Christine Perkins, she had a part in Stab 2, didn't she? She was playing CICI.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: Both of them were found brutally murdered this morning under the Hollywood sign. Autopsy reports having come back to me yet but the bodies looked like something out one of the Stab films.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: So is that why you're here? Is that why you're holding me from my show, to tell me about some brutal homicide I'm not even involved in?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: I wish that was all Miss Weathers, but there's more. The killer left a note.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: A note?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: That's Sidney Prescott's mother.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: There's more.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: I've tried to get in touch with Sidney Prescott, but she's keeping herself very well hidden. You're my one and only hope in finding her. Her life may be in grave danger.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: I'd love to help, really I wouldn't mind being sliced at again by a maniacal psychopath, but I honestly don't know where Sidney is. After Windsor she dropped off the face of the Earth. The only other person that might know is, , not going to talk.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: And who would that be?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Alright Kincaid, no where to?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: I go to the police station and do my job, and you go back to being Gale Weathers.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Oh. I thought you wanted me to stick around.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: Look, Miss Weathers, if there's a problem, give me a call. Here's my card. I'm always there.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: That's STAB 3, Miss Weathers. It looks like we're going to be getting a warrant to speak with Miss Prescott anyway.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Shit. Sarah Darling.  I interviewed her too. God, it's happening again isn't it Detective?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: Yes well we have a suspect, so don't get that worried.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: I'm not at liberty to tell you that Miss Weathers. You're no longer working with the L.A.P.D. I don't even know why you're standing in here right now. By all means I should have you thrown out.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: But you won't. You're a good man detective. We think alike. I know you need my help. And I know you know I need your help.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: In my fifteen years as a homicide detective I've never met a single soul as pushy and brazen as you are Miss Weathers.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Please, call me Gale.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: Deal, but I'm still Detective Kincaid,ok?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: Whoever it is, now is taking credit for Maureen Prescott's murder.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: But we know who killed Maureen Prescott, Billy Loomis and Stu Macher.  I mean, they even told Sidney how they did it!

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: Yeah, but, if I'm not mistaken, you said in your book that Sidney got it wrong before. She accused Cotton Weary of murdering her mother, and he was sent away for it!  Maybe there is a third killer.  Sidney Might know something

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Four? There are five.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: Ben Damon. Christine Perkins. Sarah Darling. Tom Prinze. That's four, last time I learned how to count.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: OK, look.  We all know that this has something to do with 'Stab 3'.  What we do not know is why the killer keeps leaving articles about Maureen Prescott.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: Actually, there was more this time. This time, we found a picture too.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Boys, boys, why don't we compare our gun calibers later?  The issue is Maureen Prescott!

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: Wrong, this issue is Sidney Prescott!  And either Mr. Riley is going to obstruct justice or is going to put me in touch with her.  So, where is she?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: Jesus Gale what happened?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: He killed Milton! The killer's  inside there! Oh God!  DEWEY! Dewey's in there too! He needs medical help! He's hurt!

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: Alright, calm down. I'm going to radio in for backup right now.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: The killer leaves a newspaper clipping at each murder, Sidney. Recently he's also left a photo of your mother.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Why didn't you tell me?  This is my mother, Dewey. Why didn't you say something?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: Are you sure?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Absolutely.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: What do you know about trilogies?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: You mean like, movie trilogies?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: You seem to like movies, Detective.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: Call me Mark, would you?  Cause I'm gonna keep calling you Sidney.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I'll call you Mark when you catch the killer, Detective.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: All I know about movie trilogies is in the third one, all bets are off.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Did you request this case?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: No, they tend to put me on the ones that deal with the business.  I grew up here, and I know my way around the studios.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Must be exciting, Beautiful place, beautiful people.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: To me Hollywood is about death.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: I'm a homicide detective, remember?  When you see what I see day in and day out, the violence that people do to each other, you get haunted. I think you know about that.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: I know what it's like to see ghosts that don't Go away.  To be watching a scary movie in your head, whether you want to or not,  watching it alone.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Ghosts are tough,  you can't shoot ghosts.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: Can't arrest ghosts.  But the best way to stop being haunted is to be with people.  You're here, you're not hiding, you've done the right thing, Miss Prescott.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Hmm.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: What did you know about your mother?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I used to think I had the perfect mom, perfect family.  Till I found out I was wrong.  She had a secret life, and I tried to understand that, and soon as I thought I had, more secrets.  I don't' know who my mom was.  Sometimes I feel like I'm just learning about my mother for the first time. You know, with TV and those movies and what not. God sometimes I feel like I'm just learning about myself for the first time. Like I'm watching my life instead of living in it.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: Here's the deal, I'm off to search the soundstage. That's good news.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: How is that good news?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: Because, that means that we're dealing with an ordinary, flesh and blood killer.  And I know how to handle guys like that.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Oh yeah, how?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: Catch him, or kill him.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: Mr. Rielly? My name is Mark Kincaid. I'm with the L.A.P.D. Are you aware	of last night's Events?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Yeah. A real tragedy.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: That's fine Mr. Rielly, but if anyone else should die, I'm going to have to get a warrant.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Understood.  If you'll excuse me Detective.  Gale.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: I told you, I don't know where Sidney is. And even if there was a third killer, Sidney doesn't know about it.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: That is for me to decide.  I need to talk to her Mr. Riley, she is a key element in this case.  I have a press conference in an hour, and I need to explain why there are four dead celebrities.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: What about Angelina Tyler? She was there too.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: Police are still searching through the debris. Could be days before we find her . . . that is, if she's even there.
